So, you see how `<div>` works. It's very similar to every other tag. Now, though, we can use it create our own tags.
We need one last ingredient - `id`s!
Change your two opening div tags to read `<div id="first">` and `<div id="second">`
You've just made these two `<div>`s into unique tags, because you gave them each a name!
Change your `div` line in the `<style>` tag to `div#first` . We're going to make them different colors.
Then, write another line below that for the `<div>` named "second".
It should be `div#second { color:green; }` (or a different color if you like).
Check out your page, the two `div`s should be different colors!
